meta.title: Develop a prototype considering fitness for purpose in the broadest sense
meta.purpose: This achievement standard involves developing a prototype considering fitness for purpose in the broadest sense.

grade_descriptors.N1: Evidence does not reach the minimum threshold for Achieved-level indicators.
grade_descriptors.N2: Some Achieved-level indicators are met, but not enough to satisfy all required Achieved criteria.
grade_descriptors.A3: All Achieved-level indicators are met; no Merit-level indicator meets the Merit threshold.
grade_descriptors.A4: All Achieved indicators are met and at least one Merit indicator is met, but overall performance is below the Merit threshold.
grade_descriptors.M5: All Achieved indicators are met and the Merit threshold is reached; no Excellence-level indicator meets the Excellence threshold.
grade_descriptors.M6: All Achieved indicators are met, all Merit indicators are met, and at least one Excellence indicator is met, but overall performance is below the Excellence threshold.
grade_descriptors.E7: All Achieved and Merit indicators are met and the Excellence threshold is reached, but not all Excellence indicators are met.
grade_descriptors.E8: All Achieved, Merit, and Excellence indicators are met.

omis.description: Considers the context when determining the suitability of materials and/or components, and of practical techniques and processes.
omis.detection_hint: Student must explicitly link materials/components and techniques to social or physical conditions of use. Stating a location or user without connecting it to suitability does not count. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: considering the context when determining the suitability of materials and/or components, and of practical techniques and processes
considered the social and physical environment
omis.source_ref: AS Achieved bullet list; Low Achieved commentary

omis.description: Selects suitable materials and/or components; tools and equipment; and applies techniques and processes to make the prototype.
omis.detection_hint: Evidence must show both selection (with suitability) and application during making. Listing tools without use, or showing use without stating suitability, is insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: selecting suitable materials and/or components; tools and equipment; and applying techniques and processes to make the prototype
Suitable materials, tools and equipment were selected
omis.source_ref: AS Achieved bullet list; Low Merit commentary

omis.description: Uses results from testing and stakeholder feedback to inform the making and trialling of the prototype.
omis.detection_hint: Portfolio must connect feedback/testing results to a change or confirmation in making/trialling. Saying feedback was ‘gathered’ without showing influence on decisions does not count. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: using results from testing and stakeholder feedback to inform the making and trialling of the prototype
Stakeholder feedback has informed the making and developing of the prototype
omis.source_ref: AS Achieved bullet list; Low Merit commentary

omis.description: Prototypes to gain specific evidence of fitness for purpose in the intended environment.
omis.detection_hint: Look for trialling that produces concrete evidence (measures, observations, stakeholder acceptance) tied to intended conditions. Demonstrations without explicit evaluation criteria or environment linkage are insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: prototyping to gain specific evidence of fitness for purpose
The final prototype is shown in its physical environment
omis.source_ref: AS Achieved bullet list; Low Achieved commentary

omis.description: Explains decisions to accept and/or modify the prototype based on a judgement against the brief.
omis.detection_hint: Explanation must reference the brief/specifications and state why acceptance or modification was warranted. Narrating process steps without judgement against the brief does not count. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: explaining any decisions to accept and/or modify the prototype based on a judgement against the brief
explains their decisions to accept and modify the prototype and how it met the specifications
omis.source_ref: AS Achieved bullet list; High Not Achieved commentary

omis.description: Evaluates how the combination of selected materials and/or components and practical techniques and processes work together to ensure effectiveness in making the prototype.
omis.detection_hint: Evaluation must discuss interactions (how materials/components and techniques/processes work together). Listing parts or separate pros/cons without addressing the combination is insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: evaluating the way the combination of selected materials and/or components and practical techniques and processes work together
described how this combination is effective in making the prototype

omis.description: Evaluates the prototype’s effectiveness using evidence gathered in its intended physical and social environment.
omis.detection_hint: Must include evidence from use or trial under intended conditions and evaluative statements. Images alone or generic claims without contextual evidence are insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: photographed in its intended physical and social environment
The prototype is worn by the model under lights to gather evidence
omis.source_ref: Low Merit commentary; High Merit commentary

omis.description: Evaluates fitness for purpose in the broadest sense by considering factors such as social acceptability, technical feasibility, ethics, sustainability, and life cycle.
omis.detection_hint: Response must explicitly evaluate against multiple broadest-sense factors, not merely list them. Statements without consequences for effectiveness or use are insufficient. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: considering social acceptability, technical feasibility, life cycle, ethics, sustainability of resources
considered the social and physical environment
omis.source_ref: High Merit commentary; Low Achieved commentary

omis.description: Synthesises evidence from ongoing testing (including prototyping) and stakeholder feedback to optimise the prototype and justify its fitness for purpose against the brief.
omis.detection_hint: Requires integration of multiple evidence sources into a combined rationale that informs changes or validation. Sequencing results without integration or optimisation does not count. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: synthesising evidence from ongoing testing (included prototyping) and stakeholder feedback
Evidence from ongoing testing and trials and stakeholder feedback has been synthesised

omis.description: Justifies the prototype’s fitness for purpose against the brief, using synthesised evidence and wider-context considerations.
omis.detection_hint: A justification must state a position on fitness for purpose and provide outcome-based reasoning using gathered evidence and broadest-sense considerations. Assertions without reasons do not count. Highlight the exact phrase(s) that satisfy or violate this indicator.
success_examples: justify the prototype’s fitness for purpose against the brief
The synthesised evidence … justifies the prototype’s fitness for purpose
